description: Students learn about and analyze the English language, beginning with the building blocks of language: morphology, syntax, semantics, and phonetics/phonology. Students also explore the ways humans acquire language, social and geographical influences on English, and major changes during the history of the English language. The course serves as an introduction to the applied linguistics concentration and fulfills the linguistics requirement of the Communication Arts and Literature license. Prerequisite: WRIT 120 or equivalent.
name: English Language and Linguistics
